subject: Re: [junit] DbUnit & ORM
msgSnippet: ... Are these the type of recipes one would find in your book? Cheers Shane Shane Mingins shanemingins@yahoo.com.clothes please remove clothes before
messageBody:
--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
> Now how do I test whether my transfer action
> properly handles
> insufficient funds?
>
> public void testInsufficientFunds() {
> Repository fake = new Repository() {
> public Account findAccount(String id) {
> return new Account(id) {
> public transfer(Money amount,
> Account toAccount) {
> throw new
> InsufficientFundsException(this, amount);
> }
> };
> }
> };
>
> try {
> new TransferAction(fake).transfer("1", "2",
> Money.dollars(50));
> fail("Transfer was supposed to fail!");
> }
> catch (InsufficientFundsException expected) {
> }
> }
>
>
> We fake out the Repository to serve up only accounts
> that blow up when
> we try to transfer funds. Although the syntax is
> weird, the idea is
> straightforward: no need to create a special account
> in the database
> that happens not to have enough money.

Are these the type of "recipes" one would find in your
book?

Cheers
Shane





Shane Mingins

shanemingins@...
